data.title: Jackson Joseph on LinkedIn: What an initiative!!!
data.text:
Company Description Our client is a leading provider of high-quality, customized, and cost-effective research and analytics in the areas of Investment Research, Growth Advisory, Valuation & Advisory Services and Technology Research & Advisory to global clients. Founded in the UK in 2003, Our client has a global presence including in the US, Europe, and the Middle East, and a state-of-the-art delivery center in Mumbai, India. Role Description This is a full-time role as a Manager of Sales in the Investment Research department. The Manager of Sales will be responsible for overseeing and managing sales activities, developing and implementing sales strategies, and building and maintaining relationships with clients. Key Responsibilities Business planning Develop a business plan and sales strategy for the market Create target lists of prospective clients from the various client segments Developing an action plan to achieve targets – lead generation, sales closures, etc. Building new client relationships Identify and target new clients including investment firms, private equity, asset managers, and brokerage firms for our Client's Investment Research practice Engage with clients on research opportunities and facilitate deal closures by liaising with our client's research delivery teams Build referral and lead generation network Identifying new business ideas Identify new areas for research support and working with the delivery teams to pilot and commercialize these ideas Functional Requirements: Graduate/Postgraduate from a reputed institute Experience in the US market within business services, consulting, or advisory of 4+ years is preferred. Preferable exposure to the financial services industry. Behavioral skills: Self-driven, result-oriented with a positive outlook, and a clear focus on high quality and business profit. Mature, credible, and comfortable in dealing with senior big company executives. Reliable, tolerant, and determined. Empathic communicator, able to see things from the other person's point of view. They should possess exceptional people / interpersonal skills and the ability to work with client and delivery teams. The selected candidate should demonstrate a strong track record from prior work. Experience Range: 4 - 8 years of total sales (any sales) experience. Minimum 4 years in the US Market Interested candidates can directly send their resume to Jackson @ jackson@ethikasolutions.com

It was a chilly winter evening in January, and 6 of us gathered beneath the twinkling stars, each cradling a glass of the finest scotch, basking in the comforting glow of the campfire. My friends Sunil and Manoj stumbled upon this hidden gem in Panvel during one of their routine adventure bike rides. Sunil had thoughtfully preordered a delectable feast to complement our drinks, featuring the Bombil fry, a Maharashtra delicacy crafted from the common Bombay Duck. Intriguingly, our diverse group included members from Mumbai and other states, making it the first encounter with Bombay Duck for some. As we eagerly indulged in the fish fingers placed before us, our lighthearted banter transformed into a spirited debate. I asserted that this couldn’t be Bombay duck but Basa, a type of catfish. Sunil, adamant that he had ordered Bombay Duck fry, insisted it couldn’t be Basa. James and Biju confidently declared it was indeed Bombay Duck, drawing comparisons with their previous culinary experiences. Vikram initially sided with Basa but succumbed to the majority opinion favoring Bombay Duck. Surprisingly, Manoj, a Mumbai native stayed silent throughout. The attentive waiter, overhearing our debate, interjected, unequivocally stating that the dish was Bombay Duck, effectively ending our discussion. Despite this resolution, I stubbornly stuck to my belief that it was Basa. Others playfully teased me, and though the evening progressed merrily, the lingering debate left a sour taste of self-doubt in my heart. As the night drew to a close, the waiter presented the bill, and with it, entered the chef. Apologetically, he informed Sunil that he had served Basa Fish Fingers due to a shortage of Bombay Duck! Isn’t this scenario reminiscent of many discussions among diverse groups? Reflecting on this amusing episode, the lesson becomes clear: In the tapestry of diverse opinions and perspectives, it is crucial to maintain an open mind. The evening’s humorous twist underscores the importance of humility and adaptability in the face of new information. The dynamics of our group mirrored the broader lessons of life. Some contribute without much knowledge, others remain silent despite knowing everything, and those who sway with the majority. Yet, if you firmly believe in your stance, grounded in sound reasons and information, stick to it. Sooner or later, you might find yourself vindicated.

Hi All, *GE Power* are hiring for the below mentioned roles: 1) Oracle Project Accounting Functional Location - Bangalore Exp- 10 to 15 yrs of experience Mandatory Skills- Project Accounting Functional, Minimum 4-5 years of Implementation experience, Good working knowledge on AR/AP/GL, Order Management Desired Skills: Hands on experience on coding, Data Conversion and Testing Cycles. 2) Oracle VCP Demantra Techno-Functional Location- Bangalore Exp- 5 to 10 yrs of experience Mandatory Skills- More in to Coding Role. Value chain planning (VCP), Demantra, PL/SQL Developer. 3) Oracle VCP Demantra Cloud S&OP Techno-Functional Location- Bangalore Exp- 6 to 10 yrs of experience Mandatory Skills- More in to Coding Role. Value chain planning (VCP), Demantra, PL/SQL Developer, Oracle EBS & Saas. Please share you updated resume for the above mentioned role to: komal.jha@ethikasolutions.com Kindly like this post so that it will reach to all those people who are looking out for a job, change/better opportunity. Your one like for this post might help someone who is looking for jobs in this pandemic crisis! Sharing is caring!!! Thankyou!
